    • Method Detail

      • combIter

        public static boolean combIter​(int[] vals,
                               int roof)
        After calling C(roof,vals.length) times, iterates on all combinations of vals.length integers among those in {0...roof-1}
        Parameters:
        vals - chosen integers of one combination
        roof - maximum value (excluded) a chosen integer can have
        Returns:
        false if next iteration puts vals back to {0,1,2...}, true otherwise

      • genCombIter

        public static boolean genCombIter​(int[] vals,
                                  int roof)

      • iter

        public static boolean iter​(int[] tab)
        After calling tab.length! times, iterates on all permutations of tab.length elements
        Parameters:
        tab - array representing the permutation
        Returns:
        false if next iteration puts tab back to identity, true otherwise

      • boolIter

        public static boolean boolIter​(boolean[] tab)
        After calling 2^tab.length times, iterates on all 2^tab.length possible boolean array of length tab.length
        Parameters:
        tab -
        Returns:
        false if next iteration puts tab back to false at all indexes, true otherwise

      • combine

        public static int combine​(int n,
                          int k)
        Parameters:
        n -
        k -
        Returns:
        The number of ways to choose k distinct elements from a set of n elements. The formula is C(n,k)=n!/((n-k)!*k!)
